vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
συλλῡπέω,
hurt or mortify together, σ. τινὰς αὑτοῖς make them share their grief, [Refs 4th c.BC+]
__II passive, with future -λυπηθήσομαι[Refs 5th c.BC+], also -λυπήσομαι [Refs 5th c.BC+]:—share in grief, sympathize or condole, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; τίς σοι -ηθήσετα; [LXX]
vocabInfos.shortDef: (passive) to be deeply distressed, grieved with grieve
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
(passive) to be deeply distressed, grieved with grieve
to be grieved together with; to be grieved, distressed Mk. 3:5*
